items.content:
Business Development Manager

Help us make work a better place! We provide 750 companies worldwide with a feedback platform so their employees can learn from each other and grow professionally. SoundCloud, Zapier, Strava, Duolingo and many more use our SAAS solution company-wide — from the intern to the CEO.

In an continuing effort to expand our customer base, we are looking for a business developer to assist us in working with prospects and customers alike.

This position is remote – you can work anywhere in the US EST timezone.

What you’ll do

We’re a company of 35 people in Berlin and the US and looking to grow. Our product is a performance feedback platform rolled out company-wide from the intern to the CEO. Our clients’ staff use it to give and receive feedback about their work, to set goals and objectives, organize one-on-one meetings, and to praise each other for a job well done.

We’ve got a very strong customer team in place, and want to get even better at showcasing our product, working with prospects, and ensuring a smooth roll-out. We’re not a super salesy organization, but are looking to increase the awareness of our tool. So if you are interested in making a difference in a fast-paced and international environment, this could be for you!

The job will focus on three major aspects:
  • Help convert leads into happy customers: Our pipeline is full so you’ll be busy. Our initial discovery demos with prospects are an essential gauge to determine whether our solution is the right fit for their needs. You’ll learn to understand the mindset of the HR professional, be a great listener, and never over-promise. This is a people business and our job is more guide than pitch.
  • Generate new leads: The pipeline could always be fuller! You’ll work closely with Marketing as they nurture leads upstream, actively looking for ways to connect the dots within our inbound strategy. You’ll occasionally attend events we sponsor, you’llinnovate on our existing processes, workflows and sales collateral, and you’ll help with competitor analysis to improve our targeting.
  • Ensure customers are happy beyond the purchase: Our dedicated customer success and support teams are in charge of retention and happiness. You’ll help by making the onboarding handover smooth, and offer semi-regular check-ins to ensure we close our feedback loop.
  • And more! We love people who are well-rounded and have many strengths. Sales, Success, & Support work very closely with each other – so you can expect to spend some time in another team learning about the product and space too. Beyond the core responsibilities you’re welcome to grow into other areas, and are heavily encouraged to help shape the direction of the product! If you want to spread your wings, then we can help you fly.

Who we’re looking for

You don’t have to tick all the boxes, but we are looking for someone quite special that embodies most of the following:
  • You have at least 2 years B2B sales experience.
  • You are dynamic, think outside the box, and go the extra mile.
  • You have business acumen. You don’t need to have an MBA, but you should be able to understand how companies work and be able to identify what an opportunity or a company on an upwards trajectory looks like.
  • You’re keen in learning about the HR tech market, what makes for great workplaces, what motivates people, and how the workplace of the future might look like. We can’t do our jobs well unless we really know our customers and their needs.
  • You’re a go-getter. If you think something isn’t working and could be improved, fix it! You strive to be the change you seek and like to experiment.
  • You are interested in SaaS and the online world in general, and you’re tech savvy and a quick learner.
  • You speak English fluently and write well and concisely
  • Also, you should be comfortable working remotely. Most Small Improvers work from the HQ in Berlin, including part of the Sales team. We won’t ask you to be available super early to be able to join cross-timezones calls, but you need to be comfortable being flexible to a certain extend (and Berlin people are flexible too, of course). Also, we all make a concerted effort to stay connected and overshare as much as possible, but working without the regular “water cooler talks” is not for everyone. You’ll always need to find new ways to reengage and connect with HQ people, and to be comfortable with managing your own time and workload.

More reasons to work at SI

  • We’re international: We’re based in Berlin and sell mainly to the US, Australia and the UK. Our staff of 35 hails from 16 countries (all our written communication is in English)
  • We’re self-funded, transparent and profitable, and our customer base is growing.
  • We frequently ship new features and focus on quality product rather than on aggressive sales.
  • There are very few regular meetings, and processes are kept to a bare minimum. Need to improve some process? Just do it!
  • You’re invited to visit our Berlin head office for three weeks once a year and we cover the costs. Take an office tour.
  • And we love to travel! Take a look at our last company trip.

items.title: B2B Lead Generation Specialist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
B2B Lead Generation Specialist at Expert Business Development

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

3-5 years of B2B relationship building experience required!

Earning potential: $18.25 – $27.00 hourly ($18.25 hourly + Bonuses based on performance)

Job Type: Independent Contractor (minimum 20 hours per week)

Expert Business Development (EBD) is seeking talented B2B Lead Generation Specialists to join our team. Qualified candidates must have a proven track record of success in B2B outbound cold-calling to set appointments and generate leads. This position requires a minimum of 20 hours per week of availability. Lead Generation Specialists may have the ability to expand to 40 hours per week contingent on their productivity. It is a work from home position with a flexible schedule (Monday – Friday).

A Lead Generation Specialist introduces new corporate products or services to potential prospects through outbound cold-calling. Primary responsibilities involve tracking prospects, appointment setting and following up on leads the organization provides through our CRM application, based on the clients’ project needs. A Lead Generation Specialist handles the overall appointment coordination between the prospect and the client. Our seasoned Specialists are business professionals with a strong background in building B2B relationships. EBD prides itself in building long term relationships with our clients which extend beyond the conclusion of a project.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • B2B outbound cold-calling reaching C level executives in small, mid and large size companies
  • Ability to engage gatekeepers to identify and reach key decision makers
  • Initiate calls to build rapport with key decision makers to set pre-qualified appointments
  • Record and manage prospect data within a web-based CRM application
  • Meet established productivity and performance goals

Experience and Qualifications

  • Minimum of 3-5 years building B2B relationships
  • College degree strongly preferred or equivalent work experience
  • Goal oriented, self-motivated, results driven individual working remotelyfrom a quiet home office
  • Seasoned background in cold calling and lead generation incorporating our signature “Respectful Persistence”
  • Exceptional telephone sales and documentation skills
  • Strong organizational and effective time management skills
  • Professional with a high level of integrity
  • Computer proficiency is required, including experience with CRM software

Compensation

Hourly base pay ranges from $18.25 to $21.25 based on performance outcomes, documentation skills and meeting established goals. Bonuses for qualified appointments can range from $12.00 to $25.00 based on the complexity of the project. In addition, we offer the potential for quarterly performance bonuses, documentation bonuses and bonuses for exceptional client feedback. Our better performing agents can realistically make $25 an hour or more. This is an Independent Contractor 1099 position.

About Expert Business Development:

Expert Business Development is a business-to-business (B2B) relationship development company that assists its clients in developing and maintaining crucial business sales relationships. Specifically, Expert Business Development works with financial service organizations to develop sales strategies and relationship building skills, and focuses on areas like appointment setting and lead generation, database development, expert lead management, and sales process design. The clients that Expert Business Development works with include banks, credit unions, financial providers, corporations, entrepreneurial firms and vendors to banks and financial companies. Expert Business Development was founded in 1993 and is located in Bala Cynwyd, Pennsylvania. If you are interested in learning more about Expert Business Development, please visit our website www.expertbizdev.com for additional information.

Apply for job

items.title: Senior Account Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=2, frontend=0}
items.content:
1/ WHAT IS RELAYTO?


RELAYTO helps sales & marketers to turn documents into interactive presentations & web pages with instant branding, analytics & more. It’s a $30B opportunity to re-think B2B content for the modern age.


RELAYTO is a fast-growing and award-winning (we are a Top100 European private company as awarded by Red Herring) tech startup that already worked with world-class enterprise clients such as Accenture, Salesforce, Mercedes Benz and PwC-Startupbootcamp. 


We are proud graduates of TechStars and Accenture’ Fintech Innovation Lab, Salesforce Accelerate and currently participating in the Alchemist Accelerator in San Francisco (the role is still in London).


While we have Silicon Valley DNA, our center of operations is in London, and we have remotely distributed colleagues from South Africa to Ukraine.


Curious to find out more? Check out rla.to/pitch


 


2/ Founders & Advisors


Alex Shevelenko



  • Cloud Pioneer: pre-IPO at SuccessFactors through to exit to SAP for $3.4B. Stanford MBA, ex-Salesforce and Microsoft (helped launch Office 95).

  • Consulting: only MBA student awarded by Foundation for Excellence in Management Consulting & Association of Management Consulting Firms in recognition of client work at Mercer Management Consulting / Oliver Wyman

  • Creative + Science: contributed to 50 creative/digital awards without "creative/design training" by developing Ideas Science ™ method that leverages behavioral and neuroscience research 


 


Nikita Korotaev



  • Founded & built from scratch Lectrio, the next-generation online learning environment. 

  • Scaled SaaS business to 20+ geographies: By the time he left in 2013, Lectrio was operating in 20+ countries

  • Recognized as “Exceptional Talent” by Tech City UK and won a Russian Presidential Award for top computer science students.


 


ADVISORS / INVESTORS:


We have built a network of world-class Silicon Valley advisors:



  • Aaron Au - Co-Founder/CTO of SuccessFactors (now CTO of SAP and head of SAP collaboration business)

  • Hiroki Asai, Apple GVP Marketing, who for 15 years lead all comms and 1000-person creative team working directly with Steve Jobs 

  • Steve King, ex CEO of Docusign and current Executive Chairman of Nuxeo


 


3/ DAY TO DAY ROLE


At RELAYTO, you would be a part of a small international team (Silicon Valley, London & Paris), operating primarily via Slack & Asana, and working directly with the Founders. 


While every day in a startup is different, you can expect these responsibilities:



  • Learn and continuously update understanding of the RELAYTO value proposition + sales pitch to effectively educate and generate demand from qualified prospects

  • Research and identify prospects (both inbound & outbound) and reach them through a combination of social, cold calling & email campaigns

  • Build and refine a sales process which will have a lasting impact on the future of the company.

  • Manage the pipeline! Manage junior resource to confirm qualification criteria

  • Achieve set monthly targets for leads, meetings, and sales

  • Continuously monitor B2B marketplace and competitor developments and convert new trends into scalable sales

  • If you have what it takes, and ideally 5 - 10 years of previous SaaS sales experience OR relevant experience in a related field, get in touch!


 


4/ WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?



  • You have 5+ years of successful selling to SMBs, and have experience working on deals similar in size (1k to 10k ACV) and volume to the ones you’d be working on at RELAYTO/. 

  • You have worked for an excellent SaaS Sales company. This could be a startup or a big player like Salesforce or HubSpot, but we're looking for someone who has experienced an excellent sales culture.

  • The love of the chase. If you don’t love finding innovative ways to reach prospects, we are probably not the right fit!

  • A highly competitive desire to exceed targets

  • Dazzling written & verbal communication skills that is flexible to suit different personas and markets, including the ability to create and sell great content with relevant narratives.

  • Mad problem-solving skills who is willing to put excuses aside to get to the necessary outcomes 

  • You have worked for an excellent SaaS Sales company. This could be a startup or a big player like Salesforce or HubSpot, but we're looking for someone who has experienced an excellent sales culture. 

  • You are excellent at inbound - but you're not afraid of occasional outbound. We get thousands of inbound leads per month - but there are times that outbound makes sense.

  • You know your way around a modern CRM. You will need this for your day-to-day, as well as for helping our clients as we embed deeply into CRMs like Salesforce & HubSpot.

  • You are in sales because you love helping people win. It energizes you to work alongside people to improve their business.

  • You are naturally curious and have a history of learning new things quickly. At RELAYTO, our product is always evolving, as is our market. Things will change - you need to be comfortable adapting to that change.

  • The resilience and mindset to thrive in a tough, dynamic, and feedback-driven environment

  • Absolute attention to detail while working fast

  • Team building skills. Because we are planning to grow. Fast.


 


5/ WHAT DO I GET?


We are a location-free startup, currently spanning San Francisco, London, Paris and even Johannesburg. We encourage flexibility and opportunity for working virtually or in physical teams, depending on your preference.


The primary location for in-person meetings will be in London, Paris, or San Francisco.


Once you join, these come in a package:



  • Competitive remuneration + equity

  • Remote work via Slack, Asana & Hangouts

  • Work directly with the CEO, CTO & be part of the founding team. If you are a Russian speaker - both CTO & CEO speak Russian natively :)

  • Room to grow within a startup that has only scratched the surface of its vast potential

  • Being a part of the Accenture, PwC, Salesforce and Alchemist accelerator networks

  • Ability to have a direct impact on client projects that matter (we are currently in discussion with a multinational life science company to help market its life saving drugs)

  • Exciting product challenges, in both architecture, product management and user experience.



  • A jerk-free culture defined by trust, respect, and empathy.

  • Optional personal development in product marketing & general business skills

items.title: Field Sales Representative
items.content:
BACKGROUND ON ROAM TELECOMS LTD.:


Roam Telecoms is a newly established start-up that specialises in sustainable clean technology, (Solar Powered Patented Phone) we are the first of this kind to create an actual functioning working device, of this nature. We are currently in the market to get our product white-labelled / licensing agreements - into third world and developing countries (currently in contact with government agencies). We are all about the following: Sustain. Repurpose. Recycle. Which in general has led us to our company and product creation with our level or services.


FIELD SALES REPRESENTATIVE INTERNSHIP BASED ROLE


YOUR ROLE WILL CONSIST OF THE FOLLOWING:



  • Lead generation and following up with new potential clients.

  • Signing new clients for product licensing agreements.

  • Bonus fee of 1% (negotiable) of the initial signing of the client (the client must do an upfront full payment).

  • London, UK Based but remote working!

Internship based with the strong possibility of going full time after the trial period and signing of clients. Since we are a start-up you will have the possibility of earning a small equity within the company.

items.title: Sales Development Representative
items.content:
Sales Development Representative at TaxJar

Remote

Remote · United States

Sales

Description

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 20,000 businesses. Our mission is to make eCommerce easier for everyone.

Our core values

  • We do the right thing for our customers
  • We’re a team, built on trust
  • We’re proud to be remote
  • We’re in control of our own destiny

TaxJar’s remote-only team of 100+ people is growing fast. We’re currently looking for a Sales Development Representative (SDR) who wants to make a difference on a growing, experienced team of entrepreneurs. We are looking for someone who is fanatical about helping businesses succeed while working across other functions of the organization to ensure an exceptional customer experience and drive revenue. Ensuring the happiness of our customers is everything to us.

The right candidate will be someone who enjoys speaking with people, has great organizational and communication skills, and is a team player who can work well across marketing, sales, and customer success.

Requirements

As a Sales Development Representative (SDR) you will

  • Assist with supporting TaxJar’s marketplace eCommerce customers evaluating our TaxJar Basic solution
  • Qualify opportunities and Help build the pipeline for TaxJar Plus
  • Learn, collaborate and have fun on a daily basis!
  • Be on the front lines for answering phones and following-up voice messages
  • Handle calls and leads for Amazon/marketplace customers
  • Assign new accounts and opportunities in Salesforce
  • Schedule calls/demos for sales
  • Qualify new TaxJar Plus opportunities
  • Support outbound sales initiatives

REQUIREMENTS:

  • 0-3 years experience
  • Strong phone skills
  • Rapid learner with ability to work in a fast paced, high growth environment
  • Highly-skilled in written and verbal communications (chat, video, email, etc)
  • Knowledge of Salesforce.com applications preferred
  • BS/BA degree
  • Interested in learning solution sales and growing into an Account Executive role

You’ll be a great fit for TaxJar if you

  • Have a passion for remote work
  • Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration
  • Highly value working with people you like and respect
  • Are accountable
  • Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re peers here, no egos please)
  • Are hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We’ve created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We’re profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We’re always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

Benefits

  • Excellent health, vision and dental benefits
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • $1,000 in professional development credit
  • Home office stipend
  • Equity in a profitable company
  • 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course)
  • Mandatory Birthday holiday!
  • 12 week paid maternity/ 6 week paid paternity leave
  • Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more

Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

If you’re not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we’ll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

Apply for job

items.title: Director of Business Development, Marketing & Strategic Partnerships
items.content:
Company: BRD
Company: BRD
Company: Chronicled
Company: Chronicled
Company: Defi Custody
Role and job type: Bend, OR, USA
Role and job type: Bend, OR, USA
Role and job type: San Francisco
Role and job type: San Francisco
Role and job type: Los Angeles

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced, energetic, organized and proactive business development and marketing executive to join our winning team. The individual takes ownership and responsibility, enjoys learning, and wants to grow professionally. We value someone who is skilled at assessing priorities and has exemplary accountability. BRD is growing and we are looking for a talented business development executive to help drive revenue.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Both executive and tactical level account management for some of BRD’s largest strategic relationships
  • Works closely with our CRO, CPO, and CEO on growth strategy in Asia
  • Manage key relationships with top partners and expand the brand within Asia
  • Work with BRD product and engineering teams to identify growth opportunities, develop detailed scoping of professional services, implementations, deployments, and contracts with our partners.
  • Inform, influence, support, and execute our key goals for the revenue, marketing, and business development team
  • Must be willing to respond to requests outside normal working hours (balancing Japan, Europe, and North American time zones efficiently)
Qualifications

  • Passionate, accountable, and positive
  • Must be able to work international hours when required, however, we believe in balance and flexibility for work life balance
  • Japanese and English fluency required
  • Have a good understanding and appreciation and pace of high growth startups
  • Experience with crypto, digital assets, and financial technology
  • Knowledge of compliance and regulations as they apply to security and privacy for software and custodial solutions
  • Editing and writing skills to initiate, compose, format, proofread and carefully edit various professional business documents and correspondences to clients
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Ability to organize and over-communicate with both internal coworkers and external clients on deadlines, deliverables, and contracts
  • Proven track record of growing large client relationships
  • Quantitative and qualitative analytical abilities coupled with knowledge of operating principles, running operating expense budgets, and revenue modeling
  • Experience engaging with C-level of any partner organization
  • Ability to travel international when needed
Additional Information

What it's like to work here

We've built a lively remote work culture that emphasizes regular personal interaction. At BRD, we started as a remote team and have built our workflows around it. We have a remote office in the Ginza neighborhood of Tokyo, but the coworker might also work from home or form client locations when needed.

Work-life balance is important and we strive to ensure everyone has enough time for family, exercise, and mental health. In our opinion, a happy and healthy team is an essential ingredient to finding creative solutions to the hard problems we're trying to solve.

We're more operationally transparent than you may be used to. The entire team has access to a variety of dashboards that help our distributed team make better decisions. If you have a question that can't be answered by a dashboard or an easy query, let's see if we can fix that.

BRD is committed to building an actively inclusive work environment that makes our team an excellent home for everyone.

items.title: Salesforce Program Management Senior Advisor - US Work at Home
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!



We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.



** Role will be a full time work at home opportunity



**Role Summary**



The Program Management Sr. Advisor role is a permanent position on the Salesforce Business team, a division of the Enterprise Sales Effectiveness organization. The Program Manager Sr. Advisor will plan, budget, oversee and document all aspects of mid-size and large Salesforce initiatives. The primary responsibilities will be to understand current state processes, identify process improvement opportunities, develop business requirements, document process and data flows, facilitate design sessions, and coordinate cross-functional team communication to promote successful adoption.



**Role Responsibilities**



+ Understand business priorities and successfully navigate a matrix environment to identify and engage appropriate subject matter experts.

+ Demonstrate strong leadership skills to resolve conflict, ensure accountability and keep the cross-functional team motivated

+ Build relationships and communicate to ensure support, alignment, buy-in and adoption on a regular basis

+ Deep Salesforce knowledge to enable proactive identification of how best to leverage technology to solve business issues

+ Develop and maintain a project plan to drive tasks to completion and identify and escalate risks as necessary

+ Partner with product owners, business and IT teams to develop business requirements into user stories to be prioritized for Salesforce development and implementation

+ Customer focus to ensure proposed solutions address business objectives and demonstrate improved efficiency, effectiveness and/or productivity gains

+ Strong analytical skills to proactively identify risks, mitigate risks, and utilize data to make informed decisions

+ Anticipate and plan change through formal change management activities to ensure user acceptance and adoption.

+ Dedicated to continuous improvement and learning, staying current with Salesforce capabilities, recent enhancements and partner applications to build trusted and consultative partnerships with sales to improve data quality, reduce inefficiencies and enhance productivity

+ Perform Salesforce administration activities including but not limited to application configuration, creation of workflows, process builder/flow, email templates, reports & dashboards and providing end user support as necessary.



**Qualifications**



+ Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience

+ 5+ years in a sales environment with thorough knowledge of sales processes and applications

+ 3+ years of Salesforce administration experience

+ Project management experience in a matrix environment

+ Ability to influence and balance various stakeholder needs to foster collaboration and drive change

+ Ability to look at big picture without losing site of the details

+ Intermediate to advanced skills using Microsoft Office Suite (Project, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc)



**DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS**



+ Salesforce Administration, Salesforce Advanced Administration or Salesforce Sales Consultant certifications

+ Familiarity with Salesforce Lightning

+ Change Management certifications

+ Project Management certifications

+ Experience in an Agile development environment



Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status.



If you require an accommodation based on your physical or mental disability please email: ...@cigna.com. Do not email ...@cigna.com for an update on your application or to provide your resume as you will not receive a response.

We're a global health service company dedicated to helping people improve their health, well-being and sense of security. We offer an integrated suite of health services, such as medical, dental, behavioral health, pharmacy, vision, supplemental benefits, and other related products that serve over 95 million customers around the world. When you work with us, you'll enjoy a different kind of career - you'll make a difference, learn a ton, and change the way people think about health insurance. To see our culture in action, search #TeamCigna on Twitter or Instagram.

items.title: Business Development Executive
items.content:
This application is on a first come, first served basis.


Fanbytes is an influencer marketing agency that helps brands reach young people through influencers on Snapchat, Instagram, and TikTok. 


We’ve already worked on creative campaigns for some of the biggest brands in the world (McDonald’s, Deliveroo, Apple, Universal, Sony), and now we’re looking for a confident business development executive to help us as we continue to grow.


 


Responsibilities 



  • Gathering inbound leads and working them through our predictable sales process

  • Identifying hot leads in our marketing funnels and starting conversations

  • Upselling and cross-selling existing brands on new products and ad formats

  • Creating proposals, decks, and reports to present to senior members of target brands


Requirements



  • Commercially-minded person with experience in B2B sales

  • Creative and copywriting skills to create proposals and other commercial content

  • Highly organised, efficient, and capable of managing and prioritising a diverse workload

  • Confident and social personality - you’ll spend a lot of your time on the phone and meeting clients

Salary & Benefits

  • Great opportunities for growth - we’re growing Fanbytes rapidly and want you to grow with us.

  • We’re a team of young people that believes in working hard, but also creating a fun environment. Think team breakfasts, weekly socials, and company days out.

items.title: Animalz: Agency Sales Rep
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG:surround``OR(pacif, pst, pdt, western, california, losangel, sanfrancisco, paloalto, sanmateo) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Agency Sales Rep

Animalz is a content marketing agency that strives to create the best content on the web. We help companies—particularly B2B SaaS businesses—grow by making great content that their audience loves.

Our focus is on written content that helps companies educate and inform their audiences (executives, managers and other specialized professionals in their field) on strategies and tactics for being successful in their work. Product, design, marketing, sales, and engineering are the main topic areas we cover, mostly within the SaaS/tech field.

We are hiring our first sales rep! This person will help us source and close new business. The right candidate is either an experienced content marketer looking for a new role or an experienced salesperson with some knowledge of (and ideally experience with) content marketing. Please note this is a non-commissioned sales role.

An ideal sales manager at Animalz:

  • Knows and is passionate about the SaaS, startup and venture capital industries.
  • Is friendly, personable and excited to develop a wide network of contacts in the SaaS industry.
  • Is an excellent listener and is excited to get on calls with prospects and customers.
  • Has strong presentation skills.
  • Can speak knowledgeably about content marketing strategy and SEO.
  • Is ready to help us improve our sales process.
Your day-to-day will involve:

  • Scheduling and running sales calls. This role will involve a lot of time spent on Zoom calls.
  • Creating, sending and following up on proposals. We have a process for this in place and are eager to hear your ideas on improving it.
  • Working with the Customer Ops team to onboard new customers.
  • Working with the Customer Ops team to make sure the packages we sell (1) align with the services we are best suited to provide, (2) deliver great value to the customers, and (3) are profitable.
  • Identifying opportunities for upsells and working with content managers to pitch existing customers on expanded plans.
  • Improving our existing process for maximum efficiency and transparency.
Requirements:

We are open to considering a wide range of background and experience, but there are a few basic requirements for any applicant:

  • Must have at least two years of experience working at a SaaS company or at an agency that serves SaaS customers.
  • Must be a great communicator. At its core, this job is about connecting with people. You should be eager to meet people, get on calls, and establish great relationships.
  • Must be curious about B2B content and want to learn more. This is an industry that's nuanced and constantly evolving. You should be excited to learn everything you can about content marketing.
About Animalz

We’re a remote team with a home base in NYC and team members scattered around the world. We have an eclectic team of scientists, journalists, operations folks, and more.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

About the Position:

This is a full-time (40 hours per week) remote position. Although we applaud and encourage pursuing your passion projects, we want to make it clear that this is NOT a freelance/part-time position you can do in tandem with other major professional endeavors.

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere you like, as long as you have regular overlap with both Pacific and Eastern Time when the majority of sales calls occur.
  • Health insurance, covering 80% of the premium for health and 99% for vision and dental
  • 20 paid days off per year (including holidays)
  • Paid parental leave (up to 12 weeks for primary caregivers and up to 6 weeks for secondary caregivers)
  • Unlimited sick and personal days
  • Monthly health and wellness stipend (for gym subscription or other physical activity)
  • Monthly team lunch stipend to enjoy lunch with a friend or coworker
  • Learning opportunities through internal workshops, talks, and attending conferences

hiringOrganization.name: United Nations Office for Project Services - UNOPS

items.content:
Health and Safety Advisors at United Nations Office for Project Services - UNOPS

Remote | International

Home based (multiple retainer contracts)
Job categories: Health, Safety and Environment
Vacancy code: VA/2019/B0058/18490
Level: ICS-11
Department/office: SSC, Shared Services Centre
Duty station: Home based
Contract type: International ICA
Contract level: IICA-3
Duration: 1 year (renewable, subject to organizational requirements, availability of funds and satisfactory performance)

Applications to vacancies must be received before midnight Copenhagen time (CET) on the closing date of the announcement.

Background Information – Job-specific

The Health, Safety, Social and Environmental (HSSE) management unit falls under the UNOPS Shared Services Centre (SSC) Group. It is responsible for supporting the development and implementation of HSSE good practices in UNOPS projects and operations in line with UNOPS policies, UN common system standards and international best practices. As part of its duty of care, UNOPS commits to ensuring that people do not fall sick or sustain injuries when the organisation carries out its operations. This applies to personnel at UNOPS workplaces and members of the public that may be affected by the work of UNOPS. Ensuring that people are not harmed requires the establishment of appropriate policies, standards and processes to guide operations. It also requires putting in place key controls, monitoring performance and correcting deviation from requirements.

Further to the small to medium-sized development projects that the organisation has been carrying out, UNOPS is embarking on multi-billion dollar social impact investments in the areas of renewable energy and affordable housing.

Therefore, the organisation requires the services of Health and Safety experts that shall be on retainer contracts to carry out short term work packages when required.

Please note that the selected candidates who will successfully undergo the assessments will be offered a contract for 1 year (renewable) but proposed a work package only when a specific opportunity arises.

Functional Responsibilities

  • Assist the Director of SSC and the Head of the HSSE unit, in shaping the strategic direction and policies of UNOPS in health and safety matters.
  • Provide innovative health and safety advice that helps UNOPS to assume a leadership position in implementing health and safety requirements in development sector projects.
  • Carry out health and safety due diligence of partners, contractors and suppliers prior to commencement of project work to ensure that the ones with unsatisfactory performance are not engaged.
  • Develop and implement health and safety management systems and performance monitoring frameworks for projects managed on behalf of a broad range of partners.
  • Develop and implement training programmes to improve the capacity of partners and UNOPS personnel in implementing UNOPS health and safety requirements.

Education/Experience/Language requirements

Education:

  • An advanced university degree (Master’s or equivalent) in safety engineering, occupational safety and health, occupational medicine, public health, industrial hygiene, natural sciences or other relevant field is required.
  • An additional 2 years of relevant work experience in combination with a relevant first university degree (Bachelor’s or equivalent) may substitute for the requirement for a Master’s degree.

Experience:

  • A minimum of 7 years of experience in a health and safety role is required (with an advanced university degree).
  • Experience in a project with complex health and safety considerations and worth above USD $100m is an asset.
  • Demonstrable experience in the management of the following areas is an asset: developing and implementing safety improvement plans; HS risk assessments; fatal accident investigation; and HS policy and standards development.
  • Experience in implementing or auditing ISO 45 001 or related systems is a requirement.
  • Accreditation by relevant professional institutions such as the Institute of Occupational Safety and Health (IOSH) or Board of Certified Safety Professionals (BCSP) is desirable.

Language Requirements:

  • Full working knowledge of English.
  • Knowledge of either French or Spanish is an asset.

Competencies

  • Develops and implements sustainable business strategies, thinks long term and externally in order to positively shape the organization. Anticipates and perceives the impact and implications of future decisions and activities on other parts of the organization.
  • Treats all individuals with respect; responds sensitively to differences and encourages others to do the same. Upholds organizational and ethical norms. Maintains high standards of trustworthiness. Role model for diversity and inclusion.
  • Acts as a positive role model contributing to the team spirit. Collaborates and supports the development of others. For people managers only: Acts as positive leadership role model, motivates, directs and inspires others to succeed, utilizing appropriate leadership styles.
  • Demonstrates understanding of the impact of own role on all partners and always puts the end beneficiary first. Builds and maintains strong external relationships and is a competent partner for others (if relevant to the role).
  • Efficiently establishes an appropriate course of action for self and/or others to accomplish a goal. Actions lead to total task accomplishment through concern for quality in all areas. Sees opportunities and takes the initiative to act on them. Understands that responsible use of resources maximizes our impact on our beneficiaries.
  • Open to change and flexible in a fast paced environment. Effectively adapts own approach to suit changing circumstances or requirements. Reflects on experiences and modifies own behavior. Performance is consistent, even under pressure. Always pursues continuous improvements.
  • Evaluates data and courses of action to reach logical, pragmatic decisions. Takes an unbiased, rational approach with calculated risks. Applies innovation and creativity to problem-solving.
  • Expresses ideas or facts in a clear, concise and open manner. Communication indicates a consideration for the feelings and needs of others. Actively listens and proactively shares knowledge. Handles conflict effectively, by overcoming differences of opinion and finding common ground.

Additional Considerations

  • Please note that the closing date is midnight Copenhagen time
  • Applications received after the closing date will not be considered.
  • Only those candidates that are short-listed for interviews will be notified.
  • Qualified female candidates are strongly encouraged to apply.
  • UNOPS seeks to reasonably accommodate candidates with special needs, upon request.
  • Work life harmonization – UNOPS values its people and recognizes the importance of balancing professional and personal demands. We have a progressive policy on work-life harmonization and offer several flexible working options. This policy applies to UNOPS personnel on all contract types
  • UNOPS seeks to reasonably accommodate candidates with special needs, upon request.
  • For staff positions only, UNOPS reserves the right to appoint a candidate at a lower level than the advertised level of the post
  • The incumbent is responsible to abide by security policies, administrative instructions, plans and procedures of the UN Security Management System and that of UNOPS.

It is the policy of UNOPS to conduct background checks on all potential recruits/interns.
Recruitment/internship in UNOPS is contingent on the results of such checks.

Contract type, level and duration

  • Contract type: ICA
  • Contract level: I-ICA 3 (retainer)
  • Contract duration: 1 year (renewable, subject to organizational requirements, availability of funds and satisfactory performance)

Please note that as this is a retainer contract, successful candidates will be offered a contract for 1 year but proposed a work package only when a specific opportunity arises.

For more details about the ICA contractual modality, please follow this link:
https://www.unops.org/english/Opportunities/job-opportunities/what-we-offer/Pages/Individual-Contractor-Agreements.aspx

Background Information – UNOPS

UNOPS is an operational arm of the United Nations, supporting the successful implementation of its partners’ peacebuilding, humanitarian and development projects around the world. Our mission is to help people build better lives and countries achieve sustainable development.

UNOPS areas of expertise cover infrastructure, procurement, project management, financial management and human resources.

Working with us

UNOPS offers short- and long-term work opportunities in diverse and challenging environments across the globe. We are looking for creative, results-focused professionals with skills in a range of disciplines.

Diversity

With over 4,000 UNOPS personnel and approximately 7,000 personnel recruited on behalf of UNOPS partners spread across 80 countries, our workforce represents a wide range of nationalities and cultures. We promote a balanced, diverse workforce — a strength that helps us better understand and address our partners’ needs, and continually strive to improve our gender balance through initiatives and policies that encourage recruitment of qualified female candidates.

Work life harmonization

UNOPS values its people and recognizes the importance of balancing professional and personal demands.

Apply for job

items.title: New Business Sales Lead
items.content:
Engineius is the “Uber for” vehicle movement. Whilst there are lots of “Uber for” companies out there, we really are trying to bring an on-demand platform model to a new industry – vehicle movement. We’ve got off to an excellent start with amazing blue chip clients on board - our mission now is to scale the business into a profitable market leader. Key to this the recruitment of a first-class salesperson to generate sales from new accounts.


Where you will be working


Engineius is the leading end-to-end vehicle movement platform in the UK. We match customers (who need vehicles moved) to suppliers (who move vehicles) via our software platform and mobile app. We are a true “platform” business, that drives market efficiency by algorithm matching, pricing and providing a full audit trail on work completed.


For example, a typical order for Engineius could be an online car broker that has sold a customer in London a vehicle located in Edinburgh. Engineius prices the movement up-front to the customer, guarantees fulfilment, sources a driver, and provides the driver with a mobile app to provide photos and tracking. Al this is easily managed in an online portal for customers


We already have over 30 clients despite launching in just April 2018, many of which are amongst the top fleets in the UK. Our suppliers are self-employed drivers, transporter companies and agents’ network. Looking ahead, we have an exciting business plan becoming the central marketplace for facilitating vehicle movements in the UK. As such, the business is presently moving from the start-up phase into the growth phase.


You will be an early employee in what is on-track to become a large-scale, high-profit business. Engineius is backed by venture capital; we have offices in Central London and Birmingham city centre.


As an early employee in a high growth company, you will be well positioned to move into a senior role ahead of your tenure based on the impact you directly make on the business.


What you will achieve over the next 12 months


This position has one clear objective: to deliver maximum possible sales volumes into the Engineius business. You will be incentivised and rewarded based entirely on your personal contribution to generating sales volumes for the business. Note, sales volumes refers to vehicle movement orders.


1. Sales: Maximising Sales Volumes



  • Research, review and identify Engineius potential clients across key sectors (including car sales, leasing and rental, servicing, fleet management, and manufacturers) 

  • Contact key individuals via targeted outbound contact or using existing industry network 

  • Attend sales meetings and calls throughout the sales process 

  • Complete all necessary admin and supporting activities to convert leads into live clients 

  • Maintain a comprehensive log of activities, leads and progress on the company CRM system (AirTable)


2. Other: Supporting Activities



  • Work with the Commercial team to develop product and sales strategy (eg feeding back key barriers to adoption from sales meetings, and how we overcome these) 

  • Input into brand and marketing activities to help support sales 

  • Attend industry events and conferences to promote the company 

  • Assist in maintaining competitor and market maps to further refine company strategy 


 


What we are looking for from you



  • Experience in sales or related commercial activities 

  • Ideally, experience in the fleet / automotive industry with a readymade understanding of the industry and network to leverage 

  • A passion for technology and disruptive business models

  • A very motivated, self-starting and pragmatic individual that is comfortable working in a fast-paced environment 

  • Self-confidence and ability to liaise with stakeholders at all levels of seniority

  • Excellent people skills and a naturally customer-first approach 

  • Good Solid technical skills, including market research techniques and using databases 

  • A very clear, upfront communication style 

  • Hunger for the opportunity to prove themselves and demonstrate clear positive impact on the growth of a new business


 


What you will get in return  



  • Full-time job with a competitive salary package 

  • Commission-based incentives

  • Annual compensation review based on annual appraisal

  • 25 days annual leave in addition to standard UK Bank Holidays and other Public Holidays

  • Three-month probationary period

  • Note: the location of this job is flexible depending on candidate location. Ideally candidates would work from our London or Birmingham offices, however frequent travel (required to meet clients and attend industry events) mean significant remote working may be available if needed. Standard hours of work are 08:30-17:30 Monday to Friday. 

  • Workplace pension

items.content:
Environmental Advisors at United Nations Office for Project Services - UNOPS

Remote | International

home based (multiple retainer contracts)
Job categories: Health, Safety and Environment
Vacancy code: VA/2019/B0058/18491
Level: ICS-11
Department/office: SSC, Shared Services Centre
Duty station: Home based
Contract type: International ICA
Contract level: IICA-3
Duration: 1 year (renewable, subject to organizational requirements, availability of funds and satisfactory performance)

Applications to vacancies must be received before midnight Copenhagen time (CET) on the closing date of the announcement.

Background Information – Job-specific

The Health, Safety, Social and Environmental (HSSE) management unit falls under the UNOPS SSC Group. It is responsible for supporting the development and implementation of environmental management good practices in UNOPS projects and operations. The HSSE unit also helps to set the environmental management policy and strategic direction of UNOPS in line with the UN common system standards and international best practices.

A key component of the work of the HSSE unit is to provide tools and advice to make UNOPS projects more environmentally sustainable throughout their project life cycle. This support includes carrying out or coordinating the carrying out of environmental due diligence and developing of appropriate environmental frameworks for managing the projects. The environmental management for UNOPS projects also involves monitoring performance and addressing deviations from expectations.

Further to the small to medium sized development projects that the organization has been carrying out, UNOPS is embarking on multi-billion dollar social impact investments in the areas of renewable energy and affordable housing.

Therefore, the organization requires the services of senior environmental experts that shall be on retainer contracts to carry out short term work packages when required.

Please note that the selected candidates who will successfully undergo the assessments will be offered a contract for 1 year (renewable) but proposed a work package only when a specific opportunity arises.

Functional Responsibilities

  • Assist the Director of SSC and the Head of the HSSE unit, in shaping the strategic direction and policies of UNOPS in environmental management matters.
  • Provide innovative environmental management advice that helps UNOPS to assume a leadership position in implementing environmental management interventions and contributing to sustainability in project implementation.
  • Carry out or coordinate the carrying out of project due diligence including environmental and social screening and impact assessments.
  • Carry out environmental due diligence of partners, contractors and suppliers prior to commencement of project work to ensure that the ones with unsatisfactory performance are not engaged.
  • Carry out or coordinate the monitoring of environmental performance during project execution.
  • Develop and implement environmental management frameworks including environmental safeguards tools and processes for projects managed on behalf of a broad range of partners.
  • Develop and implement training programmes to develop the capacity of partners and UNOPS personnel in implementing UNOPS environmental requirements.

Education/Experience/Language requirements

Education:

  • An advanced university degree (Master’s or equivalent) in a relevant subject such as Environmental Science, Environmental Engineering or Environmental Management is required.
  • An additional 2 years of relevant work experience in combination with a relevant first university degree (Bachelor’s or equivalent) may substitute for the requirement for a Master’s degree.

Experience:

  • A minimum of 7 years of experience in the environmental management sector is required (with an advanced university degree).
  • Experience in a project worth above USD $100m is an asset.
  • Demonstrable experience in the management of some of the following areas is desirable: biodiversity, pollution, resource conservation, waste management, climate action, environmental impact assessment.

Language Requirements:

  • Full working knowledge of English.
  • Knowledge of either French or Spanish is an asset.

Competencies

  • Develops and implements sustainable business strategies, thinks long term and externally in order to positively shape the organization. Anticipates and perceives the impact and implications of future decisions and activities on other parts of the organization.
  • Treats all individuals with respect; responds sensitively to differences and encourages others to do the same. Upholds organizational and ethical norms. Maintains high standards of trustworthiness. Role model for diversity and inclusion.
  • Acts as a positive role model contributing to the team spirit. Collaborates and supports the development of others. For people managers only: Acts as positive leadership role model, motivates, directs and inspires others to succeed, utilizing appropriate leadership styles.
  • Demonstrates understanding of the impact of own role on all partners and always puts the end beneficiary first. Builds and maintains strong external relationships and is a competent partner for others (if relevant to the role).
  • Efficiently establishes an appropriate course of action for self and/or others to accomplish a goal. Actions lead to total task accomplishment through concern for quality in all areas. Sees opportunities and takes the initiative to act on them. Understands that responsible use of resources maximizes our impact on our beneficiaries.
  • Open to change and flexible in a fast paced environment. Effectively adapts own approach to suit changing circumstances or requirements. Reflects on experiences and modifies own behavior. Performance is consistent, even under pressure. Always pursues continuous improvements.
  • Evaluates data and courses of action to reach logical, pragmatic decisions. Takes an unbiased, rational approach with calculated risks. Applies innovation and creativity to problem-solving.
  • Expresses ideas or facts in a clear, concise and open manner. Communication indicates a consideration for the feelings and needs of others. Actively listens and proactively shares knowledge. Handles conflict effectively, by overcoming differences of opinion and finding common ground.

Additional Considerations

  • Please note that the closing date is midnight Copenhagen time
  • Applications received after the closing date will not be considered.
  • Only those candidates that are short-listed for interviews will be notified.
  • Qualified female candidates are strongly encouraged to apply.

UNOPS seeks to reasonably accommodate candidates with special needs, upon request.

It is the policy of UNOPS to conduct background checks on all potential recruits/interns.
Recruitment/internship in UNOPS is contingent on the results of such checks.

Contract type, level and duration

  • Contract type: ICA
  • Contract level: I-ICA 3 (retainer)
  • Contract duration: 1 year (renewable, subject to organizational requirements, availability of funds and satisfactory performance)

Please note that as this is a retainer contract, successful candidates will be offered a contract for 1 year but proposed a work package only when a specific opportunity arises.

Background Information – UNOPS

items.title: REMOTE- Outside Flooring Sales Representative - Stone, LVT
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Outside Sales, Business Development, Natural Stone Sales, Hardwood flooring sales, Selling to Fabricators, Tile Sales, Hardscaping

If you are a REMOTE- Outside Flooring Sales Executive - Stone, Tiles and LVT with experience in the field, please read on!

We are a leading nationwide distributor of flooring, countertop, wall tile and hardscaping products. We have distribution centers across the United States and Canada. Our product line includes natural stone products imported from over 36 countries on six continents. In addition, we offer an extensive offering of porcelain, ceramic, glass and quartz products.

We are currently seeking candidates for an outstanding Flooring Sales Representative - Stone, Tiles and LVT. Ideal candidates will have experience selling to either flooring retail store, commercial construction companies or landscaping suppliers.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- AWARD WINNING EXCELLENCE (Well Trusted Leader for over 40+ years)
- GENEROUS Compensation Structure + Telecommute Flexibility OFFERED
- FANTASTIC Team and Leadership
- Excellent Benefits (Medical, Dental, Life, Vision + Short Term Disability)
- SOLID PTO/Vacation time

What You Will Be Doing

Develops relationships with current customers and potential customers within specific territory.
Assist customers by providing knowledge and training company products to their store personnel, to ensure personnel is able to present product and negotiate
well with consumers.
Understands our products, our market competition and how to position products to overcome these factors.
Manages displays, samples, and selling tools for customer availability.
Understands retail business financials to consult with dealers on retail pricing, advertising, promotions and ROI.
Quotes prices, discusses credit terms and prepares sales contracts for customer orders
Estimates date of delivery to customer, based on knowledge of company's delivery schedules.
Review and analyze various sales reports to identify sales potential with current customers and potential new customers.
Utilize any and all marketing tools such as catalogs, brochures and vendor collateral to broaden reach in territory and promote company product.
Researches and analyzes customer needs and demands based on market information.
Investigates and resolves customer claims/problems with deliveries, returns and credits.
Attends trade shows throughout the year as required.
Travels 40% - 80% locally, occasionally nationally and/or internationally.
Performs additional duties as required and or requested.

What You Need for this Position

Bachelor's Degree preferred.
Two (2) plus years' experience in channel distribution sales.
Minimum of 2 years of related industry experience; natural stone, tile or hard flooring industries.

What's In It for You

Competitive base salary plus commissions and full benefits package!
Work from your home office and travel into territory!So, if you are a Outside Flooring Sales Executive - Stone, Tiles and Hardscaping with experience, please apply today!

items.title: Business Development Specialist
items.content:
Business Development Specialist


 


Who are we? 


Hi! We are 90 Digital, a digital marketing agency with a passion for understanding what’s happening behind the scenes of websites and search engines and a soft spot for analysing  and improving online user behaviour. Putting SEO at the core of everything that we do, we aim to help innovative and purpose driven businesses connect with their customers and make their voice heard online. 


To help us work towards our mission, we're now  looking for a Business Development Specialist with a strong sales background and technical marketing abilities who can help take our growth efforts to the next level and work on improving our sales process. 


We are a distributed team working in a self-managed framework, which requires a very high degree of accountability. We are therefore looking for specialists able to work autonomously in every kind of environment, no matter where they are working from. 


 


What are we looking for?


We are currently looking for a passionate Business Development Specialist with knowledge and interest in online marketing services, eager to join our growing agency and help us get to the next level. You will work across the business to apply your marketing and sales skills on the 90 Digital brand and help us improve the lead generation results of our existing process.


This job is very exciting for somebody passionate about the digital world, marketing, new technologies and helping businesses improve their online presence. The role is ideal for an autonomous, energetic marketer who enjoys managing their own work and has a good track record of helping businesses grow and reach their potential. 


 


What You Will Be Doing:



  • Plan, manage and constantly improve the lead generation and the sales processes

  • Identify and develop new business prospects from multiple sources including inbound marketing leads, prospect lists, discovery and individual research

  • Follow through on new business sales opportunities and generate leads

  • Set targets and define strategies to reach the targets

  • Understand client needs and requirements and create business proposals to use in the sales process

  • Collaborate with the rest of the team, involving them in the lead generation process and use their particular marketing skills

  • Build and cultivate prospect relationships by initiating conversations and conducting follow-up communications 


Requirements



  • Self-starter mentality and proactive attitude

  • Good understanding of online marketing products and processes (SEO, content marketing, reputation, social media etc)

  • Strong knowledge of the UK business market and various client segments

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

  • Enjoys networking, connecting people with ideas and projects and spotting potential in various kinds of collaborations

  • A results driven attitude and good project management skills

  • 1 - 3 years experience in working with an online marketing agency or doing freelance projects (ideally in the business development/sales areas)

  • Nice to have: previous experience with Hubspot CRM


Benefits:



  • The opportunity to create your own role based on the above guidelines and on any other responsibilities you feel are important for this position

  • Work wherever and however you like  - we just care that you deliver great results!



  • Flexible working hours

  • Supportive learning environment 

  • Joining a young, fun and freedom-centered team of professionals

items.title: Advertising Sales Representatives (Digital)
items.content:
CodePeople is a unique online magazine and authority covering the tech industry through the eyes and awesome stories of the passionate people behind it. Writing about the future has never been more optimistic, fun and human. Our ambition is to uncover awesome tech stories you’ve never heard before. CodePeople optimistically strives for a more efficient and beautiful world. We inspire and empower the most talented people on the globe to THINK DIFFERENTLY.


 


Why Is This Role Exciting For You


Are you passionate about technology, the latest news and developments, digital marketing and advertising potentials in our era? Are you motivated by leading conversations, driving your own schedule, getting things over the finish line and are driven by making an impact? Would you love working for a new and rapidly growing international brand? If so, we would like to talk to you about joining our global team of independent sales representatives.


In this role, you will champion our CodePeoples’ brand vertical, technology. A prime content led tech brand which is the main source of information, dreams and ideas of ambitious people, inspiring and empowering the most talented people on the globe to think differently. You will drive digital advertising solutions sales and related products and services to the technology sector.


 


Who You Are


We are looking for a passionate sales representative to evangelize for our new technology vertical. As a trusted global brand, it is our responsibility to establish meaningful relationships with key Technology stakeholders; and manage new and existing relationships to deliver a mutually trusting and successful partnership. You will join a high-performing team of individual representatives that works cross-functionally to build new technology partnerships for CodePeople.


We are looking for a strong sales candidate with deep experience selling display advertising and media. The ideal candidate will have a mix of and Sales & business experience in an industry vertical, technology and media will be a plus. Media/advertising industry understanding, deep analytical skills, priority management, stakeholder management and the ability to reach and influence senior decision-makers and a strong ‘can-do’ spirit that drives a self-starter is a must.


 


What You Will Do



  • Develop and execute on cold calling and email campaign strategies to qualify potential customers as a match for our CodePeople brand

  • Qualify outbound opportunities and develop a strong pipeline via phone, email or other contemporary communications methods

  • Generate new technology advertising business in assigned area to increase our overall portfolio of partners

  • Meet monthly qualified opportunity goals to ensure company revenue objectives are met, and exceed your own personal earnings goals

  • Provide exceptional account management to your clients to ensure success of their programs, further developing trusted relationships


 


The Ideal Candidate



  • 3+ years of proven success in business development and/or sales role

  • Experience in digital media and advertising industry preferred

  • Bachelor’s degree or above. Excellent candidates with relevant experience will be considered

  • Must be a results-oriented professional and self-starter, with a success record to effectively build new relationships and work independently

  • Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills, with emphasis on engagement, persuasion and strong closing ability

  • Curiosity and passion for engaging with local businesses, stimulating interest on their end and helping develop effective client solutions

  • Be able to make use of modern productivity tech and internet tools like either Google or Microsoft docs, sheets, slides, mobile and social)

  • Ability to manage deadlines and to operate with a sense of urgency

  • You can make your own schedule – we’re flexible but expect results!


 


Locations


We are a remotely distributed team across the globe and are now looking to expand into the UK market with the appointment of representatives in the cities below.



  • Greater London

  • Edinburgh

  • Oxford and Cambridge

  • Manchester

  • Bristol and Bath

  • Birmingham

  • Leeds


 


Compensation


This is a high commission-based position, with an expected annual income of $75,000 and above.

items.content:
Account Manager, Corporate Relationships at Drupal Association

Remote | International

Location: Remote, Oregon, United States

Full-time

Allows Remote

Overview:

The Drupal Association serves one of the largest global open source communities – Drupal has pioneered open source for 17 years. Join our incredible, mission-driven team and make an important impact by telling compelling stories that strengthen our community, events and product marketing. We serve a diverse community – including coders, site builders, content editors, business people, themers, agency owners and more. Through conferences, webinars, marketing support and most importantly, maintaining Drupal.org, we reach many thousands of people a year in our quest to support and grow the Drupal project and Drupal as a product.

Job Summary:

The Account Manager, Corporate Relationships position is a fundraising and development role for a candidate that is a self-starter who will advocate for our clients and tackle responsibilities with ambition and passion. The role will be responsible for strengthening current corporate partnerships and establishing new partnerships that will result in funding for the immediate and long-term goals and priorities of the Drupal Association.

To be successful in this position, the candidate must have strong business to business communication skills and get excited about prospecting accounts, finding the decision maker, creating a tailored value proposition and closing the sale. They will leverage their sales and technology skills to prospect corporations in order to secure and meet revenue goals for DrupalCon Event Sponsorships, Drupal.org Digital Advertising and Corporate Memberships.

We are a small team that works very hard in service to a community of diverse needs. We are not a hip agency with an instagrammable office full of dogs and live music Mondays – but we are a committed group of humans who care a lot about each other as people, and while we work really hard, we also have a LOT of fun. Our distributed team environment supports our human-first mentality – no one needs to be stuck in rush hour when you could spend that hour (or two) doing something that makes your life better.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Prioritize creating mutually beneficial relationships with key stakeholders by understanding their business needs and how the Drupal Association can support those goals through our mission-driven programs, events, products, and experiences
  • Collaborate in the development of proposals and benefits packages for corporate prospects, and manage proposal deadlines and submissions.
  • Secure and participate in corporate partner solicitation meetings
  • Identify corporate prospects and conduct research to determine interest, giving potential, and alignment to Drupal Association’s strategic goals and outcomes.
  • Develop consultative strategies to engage, solicit, and steward new prospects.
  • Work closely with the team to provide feedback and suggestions for new and existing programs as well as sales collateral to support development process.
  • Develop a strategic approach to reach quarterly and annual goals
  • Maintain high-quality stewardship process for active corporate prospects and donors. Work with support staff to ensure that benefits and reporting requirements are met to sustain successful partnerships.
  • Manage all corporate giving and/or sales logistics and processes, including tracking secured and pending funding; drafting and securing signed agreements; coordinating with the support team to secure logos, tracking sponsor benefit fulfillment, acknowledgement, and payment in coordination with the finance team.
  • Use Salesforce to manage accounts, contacts, pipelines, and tasks.
  • Achieve greatness with a team of amazing people who are focused on building a successful Drupal Community!

Comfort with the following are key:

  • Working with a global, multi-cultural community
  • Demonstrated record of success in fundraising and corporate relationship development
  • Experience with Digital Marketing & Advertising best practices a plus
  • Working in a distributed team environment. Self-motivated in a home office environment.
  • Travel up to six times per year
  • Care about the people you work with and the communities you serve

Position Type

This position is a full time, exempt position reporting to the Director, Revenue. We are a distributed team that can be based anywhere in the world, but must overlap a minimum of 4 work hours per day with our Portland, OR, USA core team. The Drupal Association is committed to building a culturally diverse staff and strongly encourages applications from people of color and under-represented groups.

Compensation

  • Starting salary of $55,000 – $75,000 depending on experience

Benefits include

We offer all the general benefits you would expect from a modern day non-profit, plus the benefit of working with an amazing team, in an office that’s right in your favorite neighborhood with the best commute ever (your own home office!).

  • Medical, Dental, Vision and other options through our cafeteria pre-tax plan
  • 401k Plan
  • 24 PTO days per year (15 days of vacation and 9 sick leave) along with various holidays
  • Work from home with various stipend support
  • Working with a great team that cares about each other and the people we serve.

About the Drupal Association

The Drupal Association is an educational non-profit organization that tasks itself with fostering and supporting the Drupal software project, the community and its growth. Supported by both individual members and organizations, the Association uses its resources, network and funds to constantly engage in new projects and initiatives to help educate people about Drupal and support the growth of the Drupal project. The Drupal Association is committed to reflecting the diversity of the Drupal community and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Apply for job
